item.description:
SoJust's own Matt Meyer drumming with this Brazilian band. (That means dancing folks.)



It's time for Samba Tremeterra - listen to these drums!. Join us earlier for dinner at 8PM or at 9PM when we plan to bust out our hottest moves on the dance floor. (As always, doesn't matter if you don't dance. There's always a few SoJust folk hanging on the sidelines chatting it up.)

Join us if you've been looking for like-minded progressives to dance with in Boston, want to cross-promote your events and campaigns while hearing great samba tunes, or are new to the area and looking for groups to get involved in. Be sure not to miss it if you are ready to build cross-issue coalitions - AND have fun!

At Socializing for Justice (SoJust) events you can hang out with friends, make new ones, find a date, get the scoop on a job, and find out what's going on this weekend - political or social. And the best part is that SoJust members share your vision of building a more just world.

Wanna know more about SoJust? Check out our Frequently Asked Questions and learn about our Suggested Annual Membership Fee.
item.name: Samba for Justice
